channel.title: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Fizban's Treasury of Dragons" - To track additions and changes related to Fizban's Treasury of Dragons release

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: thanks for letting us know! those links have been fixed

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
On the Dragon-Touched Focus page, two of the spell links are broken:

Fizban's Platinum Shield: the text just reads "Platinum Shield" and the missing "Fizban's" part of the spell name ended up in the address part: "spell:fizbans-platinum-shieldFizban's".

Raulothim's Psychic Lance: same as above.

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: for some reason the spell was listed as for warlocks instead of rangers. the page has been updated. thanks for pointing it out, and thank you so much!

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: I noticed that Ashardalon's Stride shows as a Warlock spell here, however I don't believe it is on the Warlock list in the book. Also while I'm commenting, I want to express my appreciation to any mods reading this. This is my go-to 5th edition reference for virtually everything and I have found it infinitely helpful.

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: I agree that its a bit of a mess, but yeah, with MotM being just a month and a bit away, we could just look to waiting till then before we make a big effort in fixing things, but if anyone wanted to have a hand at giving the page touch ups that wouldn't be much of an issue

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
good catch, for some reason that clarification wasn't added to those entries. the page has been updated.

for other moderators: the Dragonborn page is a bit confusing in its layout, not helped by 3 separate sources each trying to define the race. for the Standard (PHB) and Wildemount dragonborn, they use the "Dragonborn Features" listed at the top of the page, but Fizban's clarifies its own features for the race. is it worth trying to separate the page into PHB compliant, Fizban's compliant, and UA, or should we wait until Monsters of the Multiverse comes out to throw everything into confusion again?

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
I believe the number of times that the Gem Dragonborn and Metallic Dragonborn can use their breath weapon is equal to their proficiency bonus, but the current entries don't say that.

Should the text from the Chromatic Dragonborn's description ("You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.") be added to those entries?

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: ah, I see. I think I copied the code from a magic item and thought that would have everything, but I guess it didn't, thanks for fixing it!

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: went back and fixed the items missing block code, plus some other formatting stuff. they should be good to go

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
Out of Time, there's a block of code that goes at the bottom of the item pages that's hidden from regular view that has the fields that get populated in the table. See below.

The order of what's in there, the '====' divides it up for the tables to read. Leave out the quotes, those are to make it visible.
First and last blocks, [[include….]] is what hides the enclosed data from the page
Wondrous Item (Wondrous Item, Potion, Armor, etc.)
Attuned (- or Attuned)
FTD (Book abbreviation)

'===='
[[include :snippets:suo BEGIN CODE |unique=first |type=showto]]

Wondrous Item
'===='
Attuned
'===='
FTD
'===='
[[include :snippets:suo END CODE]]

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
Works for me, they've been removed the main page and deleted from the site.

Thanks all for getting these up so quickly. Sorry it took a couple days to update the main page.

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: I think it'll probably be best to delete the UA versions of the feats. they're not different enough in my opinion to justify having them both on the page. i don't remember if there's precedent for feats from UA being made official that weren't reworked significantly (like metabolic control/tower of iron will/wild talent being scrapped and replaced by telepathic and telekinetic)

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
Subclasses have been added and updated on the main page, same with the feats and Draconic Gifts.

Is it worth leaving the UA versions of the feats on the main page? Or just delete them?

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
Hmmm, when I look at the magic items, there isn't any of the normal stuff next to it, any way I can fix that?

Added
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:dragon-vessel
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:scaled-ornament

Edited
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:figurine-of-wondrous-power

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: Heres the draconic gifts: http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/draconic-gifts

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: excellent work! i think you can use the ioun-stone page as reference for how to edit the figurine of wondrous power page. we generally include all modifications of previous items in the same page, just adding clarification that it was added in a later publication. then you can add the statblock underneath the figurine's description like we've done for things like the Battle Smith's Steel Defender or whatever

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
Great. Do you think I should put the Gold Canary Figurine of Wondrous Power on its own page? Because it has 2 transformations and is from a different source from the others. Also, it seems to have a unique or at least uncommon statblock associated with it, but the other figurines don't put the statblocks of the creatures they summon there, so should I add it?

EDIT 1: added these regular magic items and tagged them
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:platinum-scarf
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:potion-of-dragons-majesty
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:ruby-weave-gem
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:sapphire-buckler
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:topaz-annihilator

EDIT 2: added these hoard magic items and tagged them
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:dragons-wrath-weapon
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:dragon-touched-focus
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:dragon-vessel

EDIT 3: added something to this
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:figurine-of-wondrous-power

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: Ill get to work on the Draconic Gifts so as to add them to the Misc section. I know they could theoretically go into the Wondrous Items page due to more or less how they function, but I think the way they operate in story has them make more sense as part of the rest of the charms boons and all. Afterall, you can find a vorpal sword in a chest, but you wont really find a dragons blessing in a chest

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
I think in the past if a new version of a spell is published we've just replaced the UA version. I think the only persistent UA spells we have are the ones that were never published; like the Modern Magic spells and a few that were being considered for Tasha's.

I'll work on getting the links moved around on the main page.

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: was wondering why the items weren't appearing on the pages even after i added tags, realized its because the page urls were "wondrous-item" not "wondrous-items". changing the urls rn, make sure it's consistent with the other items! (i'd help add them, but i dont have fizbans or any of the newer books, so im just helping with formatting)

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded: keep in mind those aren't all of the magic items, its a little over half

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
added tags to the spells and magic items, so they should be showing up in the right places soon. the cure wounds link for Gift of the Metallic Dragon is working for me, so maybe it's just on your end. only things now are to move drakewaren, way of the ascendant dragon, and the feats from homebrew to official on the main page.

additionally, i dont remember what we do if theres published spells that are updated versions of UA (like Ashardalons Stride vs Flame Stride or the 2 versions of Nathair's Mischief). do we delete the UA pages and leave the new published ones, or do we have a sort of "archived UA" like we do for subclasses and stuff?

item.title: Re: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
added the subraces to the dragonborn page, tried to add ascendant dragon monk but encountered "page does not exist" error, despite making the page

EDIT: fixed problem by renaming the page to something else and then back, and finished adding ascendant dragon monk

EDIT 2: added these feats

item.title: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
item.content:encoded:
